section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The contradiction lies in stating the customer is responsible for paying the monthly fee and then saying they can pay it at their 'discretion and convenience.' This contradicts the initial statement of responsibility and introduces ambiguity. While failure to pay in a 'timely manner' is mentioned as potentially leading to service interruption, the definition of 'timely manner' is missing, and allowing payment at the customer's discretion makes enforcement of timely payments difficult, weakening the provider's ability to ensure consistent revenue.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: The section contains conflicting information regarding termination. The first sentence describes an automatic renewal with a 15-day notice requirement for non-renewal. The second sentence allows either party to terminate the agreement 'at any time' with a 15-day written notice. This creates ambiguity: can a party terminate *during* a renewal term even if they didn't give notice of non-renewal 15 days before the *start* of that term? The 'at any time' clause contradicts the conditions set for automatic renewal and creates uncertainty.

section: i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: The first part of the sentence states that I-on WILL be liable under ANY circumstances for any lost profits, while the second part of the sentence immediately contradicts this by stating that I-on's liability for damages will be limited to one (1) month's fees.
